comments.body: I've been thinking this same thing! Sea level being around 63 makes no sense. I realize backwards-compatibility might mess up but they could just make it to where when you load up an old world it just automatically fixes the issue by raising the world.
An idea that could help with lighting things up is being able to shoot torches with crossbows, making it much easier to light dark areas underground.

It's good. post it on the main post for Noise Cave, maybe?

@Frostbite Boss4 https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360077127672/comments/360014281071

making a suggestion and posting your link in it.
Maybe just restrict them to generating within the deep dark then?

Taking content away from other parts of the game isn't what new biomes are about. If you want people to search for these biomes, it would be better to just pump up the amount of redstone found in the biome. Plus, if it's a biome revolving around redstone, it would be expected that it would contain related thematic elements such as power and energy transfer.
Perhaps in this Redstone Cave biome, blocks that can be powered by redstone are automatically powered because there is a Redstone charge in the air (the red particles you mentioned)
Include Redstone Crystals like the ones in Minecraft Dungeons
Maybe it should also drop some sticks when doing so?
You should also be able to craft dirt with hanging roots to make rooted dirt.
yes! yes! YES! Y E S! I was gonna suggest this!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

RunOut64

perhaps it drops hanging roots?
Like wool?
406758345491 Yes basically
Yes! It makes sense that a soft moss block would uniquely share this property with the wool block, like it also shares the ability to make carpets.
I really love this idea. I think it would be cool if there was a way to have a bunch of lights that get brighter the closer you get and dimmer the further you get

408937330551 I would say that would be cool, But It'd be cooler If the Sculk barnacles Became dimmer the CLOSER you go, and Brighter the further you are. It'd be pretty cool for Horror maps and be something nobody's ever thought of before.

This is a really good idea. These barnacles should be created if the sculk grows over cave plants like glow lichen and glowberries, but also if it consumes flowers. At the moment it just ignores flowers
Good idea! It makes sense as rain already does this, so why don't water bottles?

Hi! Please don’t do this! I’m worried this may promote animal abuse as an axolotl can not survive on land, rehydrated or not. It is extremely painful for them to be out of water in real life and I believe minecraft should reflect that.
I don't think it does? I think the lichen only spawns in mesh caves.
The deep dark isn't added yet.
This Is True I Think
That's a very good idea.
I was thinking concrete blocks could be dyed using glow ink so we could have different colored glowing light blocks.
I agree, perhaps a four by four recipe though, with 13 or 14 light level
I have seen a new bug in Minecraft tho
This is from Terraria.

I like the idea of a camouflaged mob in the game but I think adding common fantasy tropes to the game is a little trite, even for minecraft. OTOH capturing them for your base or in a player made dungeon would be really cool, and would be nice for mansions too. If there were to be a mimic in the game it should mimic blocks IMO.
I like the idea of an achievement rewarding players for exploring caves, but time-passers generally just convince players to AFK (I did this for Sleep with the Fishes).
I think this would be a great idea! Maybe you could get an emote or caveman clothes for your skin from it!
Shouldn't just be exclusive to one platform.
No, it should spawn naturally too. In villages, basically, anywhere a player can spawn.

383465765852 how could it even work on java edition? You only are able to have one skin equipped at a time, and you aren’t able to access your skins at all in-game, so how do you think it could work? I get the technical/commands part of it, but how could the skin part of it work in Java Edition?
Op
That's jukeboxes that use diamonds, noteblocks use Redstone
^ I think OP meant jukebox, if that's the case I agree. Needing diamonds just for a jukebox never made sense.
number 2

Yes I agree that would be a good enchantment: In fact, I have another idea, though it would alert the Warden of your presence, it would be good for escaping one; the potion of echoing would cause your vibrations to resonate throughout the cave better and causes the Warden to be confused as to where the vibrations are coming from. It would be similar to the potion of invisibility for a Warden, although it does provoke the Warden.
The second idea would be better
i like the first
i like the first
Thanks for the feedback and Isaac Annear I love the idea of a potion of echoing
It's certainly an intersting idea! I wonder if new players will get confused, though. They might think that their axolotl actually died and their body is still there because of a bug.
I would instead have it so they fall over, don't turn red but then turn invisible or teleport away. The fact that they don't turn red is the sign that they aren't dead
Or, all mobs in Minecraft could be made to not immediately disappear, just fade over time. That way, axolotls would appear to be dead but not fade away even after awhile
The current axolotl animations may just be so the player still knows they are alive, as well as the fact that it is more realistic, but I would prefer them to match the current mob deaths

I'm thinking the axolotl flips over and turns red and closes it's eyes, completely stops moving. Once it heals it will flip back over and continue fighting 

cranzag I don't like the idea of it disapearing when it plays dead because its obvious the axolotl isn't dead when it doesn't disappear with particle effects. If they disappeared it would look like they died
@Ultimatexplay36 That's my point
I like that!
The smell thing being almost as a potion effect like "scent of... Causes goats to charge at you"
This actually makes sense.

You should also be able to light a jack-o-lantern by holding the light source in your hand and placing it on the block, so you don't have to place the blocks down, carve them with shears, pick them up again, craft them into glowing jack-o-lanterns, then place them back down. This way, you could just place them where you want, carve them with shears, and place the light in them.
yeah, was about to post this myself but decided to look first, definetly agree
yes please

I know the reason behind the change was due to perfomance but I do want the sculk to be "inactive" or not moving unless activated. And i liked the movement to wiggle back and forth rather than side to side
Agreed. The animation before was unique and now it feels like it got downgraded.
You should put this in the snapshot category too.
Markarecave132
Markarecave132

Skulk sensors emit redstone signals and detect vibrations. In any case this is a great idea as it’s a use for copper irl. You could also use this to send direct signals to skulk sensors without using wool occlusion which is messy. The copper could also have a signal strength mechanism; like redstone; based on how far away from the source it is.

It's a spyglass, not a telescope, however, I agree.
As an addition, you can put a crossbow there to make a mini-ballista.

I don't think sea pickles should be placed inside of the frozen lakes seeing that they generate at the bottom of the warm ocean biome. And depending on how the glow squid is added I don't think that should be added under it either but i do think a frozen lake would make a great addition to the game!
Mojang(or at least that one dude) also said they were looking into actual uses of crystal, right?

this is that kinda insightful idea that would be great if added.

I think we really need to push these copper/amethyst redstone related posts
We really need colored wires. That would blend redstone and builds much easier without having it all look like a bloody mess
Mirrors sound like a more Minecraft version to me, with just reflecting images. Because mirrors are said to not be added, I doubt these would as well

I don't get your reasoning there at all. How do mirrors even relate to redstone, let alone being more vanilla than wires? More over, a block that can reflect an image and wires that transfer a redstone signal are completely unrelated, so  invalidating mirrors has absolutely no relevance to this post.

Did you just see "fiber optics" and skip the entire post?

I read the post, but because of your title I assumed that your wires were designed for the purpose of sending images, which is what fiber optics do, along with the things mentioned in the post such as being waterloggable, colored, wall-placeable, etc. Because of that, I stated that mirrors would be better as mirrors have been around long before wires plus the fact that they can be arranged to reflect images to a certain point, essentially sending images. I would suggest updating the title of your post if it has nothing to do with fiber optics

It's less about It's actual usage and more that it is a wire made of silica, which is most commonly found as quartz, and has the ability to extend signals over longer distances at greater bandwidths.

That being said, I would love to remove fiber optics from the title, but I'm too scared of the approval process' unreliability to edit the post.

Any light that enters an amethyst block will come out the other five faces. This means that light can be transmitted through a (long) line of amethyst blocks and can be converted to a redstone signal with a comparator or observer. However, raw crystal blocks probably have many impurities that diffuses light instead of focusing it, causing the light to dissipate, making it unreliable, so you would have to craft "Cut Amethyst." Cut Amethyst would be crafted from four shards placed in the four middle slots on the grid, Block of Amethyst in the core of the block, as it would diffuse light isotropically, allowing shards that are not in the path of the light beam to receive the light (thus allowing the signal to change directions), and four tinted glass in the remaining slots to prevent light from passing on diagonally.

   This could also be used to tell the time of day if you were not exposed to the sky, to measure the light level and utilize the signal generated from it in a redstone device, or simply as a different kind of light source.

   Notes:

Cut Amethyst cannot function as a light source, but Block Amethyst can so long as it is subjected to light.

Cut Amethyst will instantaneously send light from each end of a long line of it.

Cut Amethyst light transference is limited to 256 blocks.

Block Amethyst can emit a light level of 30 when combined with two light sources, and 45 with a beacon. More than two non-beacon lights will melt the amethyst.

Amethyst is renewable.
